marketNews.title: BOJ to raise rates to 0.5% as inflation hits 2.9% YoY
marketNews.content: The Bank of Japan is expected to raise its policy interest rate by 25 basis points to 0.5% on Friday (24 January 2025), marking the highest level since October 2008. The move is part of the central bank's normalisation process as Japan's inflation reached 2.9% year-on-year in November 2024, exceeding the 2% target, and domestic wages have also risen.

marketNews.title: Trump says U.S. may impose 10% tariff on Chinese imports
marketNews.content: U.S. President Donald Trump said he is considering imposing a 10% import tariff on goods from China starting 1 February 2025, a lower rate than his campaign promise of a 60% tariff. He said the proposal is based on the fact that China ships fentanyl to Mexico and Canada. Previously, Trump announced a 25% tariff on Mexico and Canada, citing those countries' allowance of migrants and illegal drugs. He also mentioned the possibility of a tariff on the European Union, without providing details.

marketNews.title: Indonesia's gas price incentive to rise above US$6 per MMBtu
marketNews.content: Energy Minister Bahlil Lahadalia said on Wednesday (22 January) that the price of natural gas under the Gas Price Incentive (HGBT) is likely to rise and will no longer be fixed at US$6 per MMBtu. He estimated the price for gas used for power generation at about US$7 per MMBtu and for feedstock at about US$6.5 per MMBtu. Although HGBT was previously set at US$6 per MMBtu, the price payable by eligible companies since mid-2023 has varied between US$5.39 and US$8.05 per MMBtu. The incentive will continue to cover the same seven industrial sectors, and the government plans to set the incentive for five years instead of one year.

marketNews.title: IDX announces index composition changes for LQ45, IDX30 and IDX80 effective 3 Feb-30 Apr 2025
marketNews.content: The Indonesia Stock Exchange announced on Wednesday (22 January) a review of the composition of the LQ45, IDX30 and IDX80 indices, effective 3 February to 30 April 2025. For the LQ45, the additions are $CTRA, $JPFA and $MAPA, while $BUKA, $INTP and $MTEL will be removed. For the IDX30, $EXCL and $ISAT will be added and $ACES and $PGEO will be removed. For the IDX80, $LSIP, $SSIA and $TAPG will be added and $BUKA, $MPMX and $SMDR will be removed.

marketNews.title: KPK says it will investigate alleged misuse of Bank Indonesia CSR funds in House of Representatives Commission XI
marketNews.content: The Director of the Corruption Eradication Commission, Asep Guntur Rahayu, said the commission has recorded that the Bank Indonesia corporate social responsibility (CSR) fund transferred to the House of Representatives Commission XI amounts to several trillion rupiah. He added that the commission will investigate the claim by a NasDem party member that all members of Commission XI received the BI CSR fund held in a foundation, and that some of the money was not used for its intended purpose.

marketNews.title: Bharat Petroleum to invest US$121 million in Indonesia's Nunukan oil-gas block
marketNews.content: India's Bharat Petroleum Corp (NSE: BPCL) announced a US$121 million investment to develop the Nunukan oil-gas block in Indonesia. Its exploration unit, Bharat PetroResources, holds a 16.23% stake in the block, which is operated by PT Pertamina, and the company is seeking Indonesian government approval for the development.

marketNews.title: Indonesian parliament moves to revise the Mining Law
marketNews.content: The Indonesian House of Representatives on Thursday (23 January) agreed to launch a formal process to amend the Mining Law. The revision aims to accelerate the development of mineral processing industries and to allocate mining licences to religious groups and universities. The draft also proposes priority access to mining areas for certain companies for downstream processing and gives priority to small- and medium-sized enterprises for mining areas under 2,500 hectares to support the local economy.

marketNews.title: Indonesia's M2 money supply expands 4.4% YoY in December 2024
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia reported that broad money (M2) grew 4.4% year-on-year to IDR 9,210.8 trillion in December 2024, up from a 6.5% year-on-year increase in November 2024. The growth was driven by a 5.8% year-on-year increase in narrow money (M1) and a 0.3% year-on-year rise in quasi-money.

marketNews.title: Buana Finance secures IDR 250 billion consumer-finance loan from Bank Victoria International
marketNews.content: Buana Finance signed a credit facility worth IDR 250 billion from Bank Victoria International with a tenor of up to 48 months. The facility is intended for consumer-finance lending.

marketNews.title: Pakuan to raise IDR 218 billion capital for PT Vasamty Land Sawangan
marketNews.content: Pakuan announced a plan to increase the capital of its subsidiary PT Vasamty Land Sawangan by IDR 218 billion through a partial issuance of new shares. The capital increase will fund the subsidiary’s real-estate development, with construction expected to start in 2025 and commercial operations and revenue generation projected for 2026. The plan will be discussed at an independent general meeting of shareholders on 28 February 2025.

tickerNews.title: BBCA reports FY24 net profit of IDR 13.8 trillion, up 12.7% YoY
tickerNews.content: Bank Central Asia reported net profit of IDR 13.8 trillion in 4Q24 (-3% quarter-on-quarter, +13% year-on-year). The result lifted full-year 2024 net profit to IDR 54.8 trillion, a 12.7% year-on-year increase and exactly 100% of the FY24 consensus estimate. The performance was supported by: (1) Net Interest Margin (NIM) in the upper part of the guidance range; (2) credit cost (CoC) in line with guidance as asset quality remained sound; and (3) credit growth that exceeded guidance. NIM for the bank-only segment rose to 6% in 4Q24, putting FY24 NIM at 5.8% within the upper guidance range of 5.7-5.8% after an upgrade. Management targets FY25 NIM of 5.7-5.8%. CoC for the bank-only segment was –0.1% in 4Q24, resulting in a FY24 CoC of 0.3% in line with the 0.3-0.4% guidance; asset quality stayed strong with gross NPL at 1.8% and loan-at-risk at 5.3%. Management targets FY25 CoC to remain at 0.3%. Credit growth in FY24 was stable at +13.8% year-on-year (versus +13.9% in FY23) and beat the upgraded guidance of +10-12%. Credit growth was driven by corporate-segment loans that rose 15.7% year-on-year, mainly from investment-grade loans. Management targets a moderate credit-growth pace of +6-8% in FY25.

tickerNews.title: LINK confirms it is aware of shareholder-initiated divestiture process
tickerNews.content: Link Net confirmed to the Indonesia Stock Exchange that the company is aware of a share-pursuit process by its shareholder to approach potential investors, but LINK has not received any further information from the shareholder and no material event has occurred. The clarification follows a DealStreetAsia report that Axiata Group plans to divest its LINK shares for a value of about US$1 billion (approximately IDR 16 trillion). Axiata holds 94.64% of LINK, split between Axiata Investments (Indonesia) Sdn. Bhd. (75.42%) and XL Axiata ($EXCL) (19.22%). As of Thursday (23 January) LINK’s market capitalisation was IDR 6.6 trillion.

tickerNews.title: Campina Ice Cream Industry’s controlling shareholder buys 2.4 billion CAMP shares
tickerNews.content: Campina Ice Cream Industry’s controlling shareholder, Sabana Prawirawidjaja, bought approximately 2.4 billion shares of CAMP from CEO Samudera Prawirawidjaja at an average price of IDR 230 per share on 27 December 2024. The transaction value was about IDR 541.4 billion and was intended for business purposes. After the transaction, Sabana’s ownership rose from 43.94% to 83.94%, while Samudera’s stake fell to zero.

tickerNews.title: PGEO targets 4,930 GWh electricity production in 2025
tickerNews.content: Pertamina Geothermal Energy targets electricity production of 4,930 GWh in 2025, a 2.12% year-on-year increase over the 2024 estimate of 4,827 GWh. The increase comes from the commissioning of the Lumut Balai Unit 2 power plant, which is expected to be commissioned in May 2025, raising total installed capacity to 728 MW (+8% YoY). PGEO also plans a capital expenditure of US$319 million in 2025, versus a 2024 capex estimate of US$180 million.

tickerNews.title: PGAS forecasts 2025 gas sales and capex
tickerNews.content: Perusahaan Gas Negara (PGAS) projects commercial gas sales of 873–958 billion standard cubic feet per day (BBtud) in 2025, up roughly 2%–12% year-on-year versus the 2024 estimate of 852 BBtud. Transmission gas sales are forecast to fall 7% year-on-year to 1,435 MMSCFD, down from 2024’s 1,543 MMSCFD. Oil and gas sales are projected at 17,227 barrels of oil equivalent per day (BOEPD), a 16% year-on-year decline from 20,424 BOEPD in 2024. Oil-transport volume will rise 11% year-on-year to 178,347 BOEPD, up from 2024’s 161,174 BOEPD. PGAS allocates US$338 million for 2025 capex, compared with a 2024 estimate of US$258 million.

tickerNews.title: Saratoga Investama Sedaya to allocate US$100-150 million in 2025
tickerNews.content: Saratoga Investama Sedaya’s investment director Devin Wirawan said the firm will allocate US$100-150 million in 2025, similar to the US$150 million capex realized in 2024. After the mid-2024 divestment of PT Deltomed Laboratories, the firm does not plan to sell any other portfolio companies in 2025 because many companies are still under development.

tickerNews.title: HRTA secures IDR 400 billion loan from BBRI
tickerNews.content: Hartadinata Abadi signed a loan facility of up to IDR 400 billion from Bank Rakyat Indonesia with a three-year tenor and an interest rate of JIBOR 1-month plus 1.85% per annum. The facility is intended for capex, working-capital and/or general corporate purposes.

tickerNews.title: SRAJ targets 10-12 hospitals and reports 57% bed-occupancy in 2024
tickerNews.content: Sejahteraraya Anugrahjaya said to the IDX that the company aims to own 10-12 hospitals in major cities. In 2024 the company built one new hospital in the new capital city, bringing the total to seven hospitals. By the end of 2024 the bed-occupancy rate rose to 57% from 49% in 2023, while the number of operational beds increased from 780 to 860.

tickerNews.title: MARK director Riana purchases 700,000 shares
tickerNews.content: Mark Dynamics Indonesia’s director Riana bought 700,000 shares of MARK at an average price of IDR 965 per share on 20 January 2025, for a total transaction value of IDR 675.5 million. After the transaction, Riana’s ownership rose from roughly 0% to 0.02%.

tickerNews.title: CMNT secures US$1.05 billion syndicated loan facility
tickerNews.content: Cemindo Gemilang signed a credit facility worth US$1.05 billion from Bangkok Bank and Bank Permata. The facility consists of a US$420 million tranche A (84-month term, extendable 24 months), a US$30 million tranche B (72-month term), a US$53 million revolving working-capital facility, and a US$550 million protection facility with a 12-month term.

tickerNews.title: HILL announces 1-to-5 stock split effective 10 March 2025
tickerNews.content: Hillcon plans a 1-to-5 stock split, with trading to begin on 10 March 2025 at a new nominal value per share in the regular and negotiation markets.
